hook.text: You embed an entire 50-page PDF as one vector. The user asks about a paragraph on page 37. The single vector averages the whole document and misses the specific paragraph entirely.

buildup.text: Chunking splits documents into smaller pieces â€” paragraphs, sections, or fixed-size blocks â€” each with its own embedding. Retrieval then finds the right piece, not just the right document.

discovery.text: Good chunk size is a goldilocks problem: too small and you lose context. Too large and the embedding becomes vague. Typical sweet spot: 200â€“500 tokens per chunk.

twist.text: Chunking strategy has more impact on RAG quality than the choice of embedding model or vector database. It's the most underrated component in the pipeline.

climax.text: Test different chunk sizes on your actual data and queries. Measure retrieval precision before touching anything else.

punchline.text: Bad chunks â†’ bad retrieval â†’ bad answers. Chunking is where RAG quality starts.
